basic.description: An interdisciplinary study of selected topics such as culture, ethnicity, health, sexuality, religion, economics, politics, African feminism's, agriculture and environment relevant to the study of women and gender in Africa south of the Sahara. This course contains an intensive and independent study component.
basic.subject: GNDS
basic.title: Women and Gender South of the Sahara

extra.enrollment_requirement: Prerequisite of Level 3 or above in a GNDS Major or Medial or SXGD or a DEVS Major or Medial plan, or permission of the department and an exclusion of no more than 1 course from GNDS422; WMNS422.
